news.content:
The phpMyFAQ Team is pleased to announce [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-RC.4](/download), the "Rita Süssmuth" release.
This release fixes all reported bugs, and we updated our third party dependencies.

The phpMyFAQ Team would like to announce the availability of [phpMyFAQ 4.0.17](/download) and [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-RC.3](/download),
the "Renée Good" releases.
These releases fix security vulnerabilities, update all third party dependencies, and fix all reported bugs.
[Click here to find a detailed security advisory](/security/advisory-2026-01-23).

The phpMyFAQ Team is pleased to announce [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-RC.2](/download), the "Brigitte Bardot" release.
This release fixes all reported bugs, we updated all translations with Claude Code, and we updated our third party 
dependencies.

The phpMyFAQ Team would like to announce the availability of [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-RC](/download),
the "Chris Rea" release.
This release fixes security vulnerabilities, improves the experimental plugin manager, fixes all reported bugs, and 
updates our third party dependencies.
We also updated various bundled translations.
Additionally, we also released [phpMyFAQ 4.0.16](/download), the "Perry Bamonte" release, 
which fixes the same security vulnerabilities.
[Click here to find a detailed security advisory](/security/advisory-2025-12-29).

The phpMyFAQ Team is pleased to announce [phpMyFAQ 4.0.15](/download), the "Rosa von Praunheim" release.
This release fixes all reported bugs, and we updated our third party dependencies.

The phpMyFAQ Team would like to announce the availability of [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-beta.2](/download),
the "Rob Reiner" release.
This release fixes all reported bugs, improves A11Y, updates Vitest to version 4, and some translations.
Additionally, we updated our third party dependencies.

The phpMyFAQ Team is pleased to announce [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-beta](/download), the "Kessler Twins" release.
This first beta release is now feature-complete and introduces full support for PHP 8.5,
fixes the reported bugs, and we updated our third party dependencies.
We added a high-contrast mode for better accessibility.
In addition, we already prepared phpMyFAQ for PHP 8.6 by fixing deprecations.

The phpMyFAQ Team would like to announce the availability of [phpMyFAQ 4.0.14](/download),
the "Ace Frehley" release.
This release fixes a security vulnerability, fixes the reported bugs, and we updated our third party dependencies.
[Click here to find a detailed security advisory](/security/advisory-2025-11-15).

After eleven years we finally re-built our website from scratch.
The content is still the same, but the design is now modern and responsive.
We also migrated from the old Assemble-based site to a new static site based on Next.js.
We made heavy use of Anthropic's Claude Code to help us with the content migration.

We’re excited to announce the release of [phpMyFAQ 4.1.0-alpha.3](/download), the "Jane Goodall" release.
This version introduces several new features and experimental improvements.
You can now edit the llms.txt configuration file and benefit from full EU Data Act 2025 compliance.
A new dark/light mode toggle enhances the user experience.
In addition, this release adds experimental support for PHP 8.5, FrankenPHP, LDAP group integration, MCP Server,
updates via the command line, .env file configuration, and Mago.
